RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: He took his degree in Electronic Engineering at the University of Bologna in 1998 and obtained his PhD in Automatic and Operations Research in 2002 under the supervision of proff. Toth and Martello. He was post-doc from 2002 to 2004 at the Dipartimento di Informatica e Sistemistica (DEIS) of the University of Bologna. Since 2005 he is Assistant Professor in Operations Research at the Department of Information Engineering (DEI) of the University of Padova. He regularly attends to national and international conferences on Operations Research and Combinatorial Optimization. He was invited speaker at the Mixed Integer Workshop MIP 2010 (Atlanta, GA) and Integer Programming Combinatorial Optimization IPCO 2011 (New York, NY). He is co-author of more than 30 publications in international journals with referees, among which Mathematical Programming, Operations Research, Management Science, INFORMS Journal on Computing,Transportation Science, Discrete Applied Mathematics, Computers and Operations Research and European Journal on Operational Research. He acts as referee for several international journals, including Mathematical Programming, INFORMS Journal on Computing, Operations Research and Discrete Optimization. He is also co-author of several abstracts and extended abstracts in proceedings of international conferences (EURO, IFORS, ALIO/EURO among others), often organizing invited sessions. He has been in the program committe of the conferences ICORES 2012 (Vilamoura, Portugal) and ICORES 2013 (Barcelona, Spain). His research activity concerns the development of exact and heuristic algorithms for Combinatorial Optimization problems with special emphasis to problems that arise in real-world applications. In particular he studied cutting and packing problems, optimization problems in railways applications, scheduling problems, heuristic and exact algorithms for Integer Linear Programming and robust optimization. He has international collaborations withe the research groups of the University of Graz (Austria), University of Newcastle (Australia) and with the IBM-CPLEX research group.
